[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
あの後のスーパーでも同じやり取り。
気まずくてしばらくあの商店街に行けないぞ。
……まぁネコの可愛いところと言われればそうなんだけども。
[バニラ]: 「ん？　くんくん、くんくん……」
[バニラ]: 「あっちからすごくいい匂いがする」
[ショコラ]: 「ほんとだ、すごく香ばしくていい匂いがしますご主人さま！」
[嘉祥]: 「確かに。この匂いは……」
匂いのする方角へと顔を向ける。
[屋台のネコ]: 「いらっしゃいませー！」
[屋台のネコ]: 「おいしいできたてのたこやき、いかがですかー！」
[屋台のネコ]: 「あっつあつで、かつおぶしたっぷりのたこやき、いかがですかー！」
[ショコラ]: 「わぁ、ネコのたこ焼き屋さんだ！　珍しいですね、ご主人さま！」
reference_answer:
After that, it was the same sort of exchange at the supermarket.
The whole thing was so awkward that I don't think I can visit that shopping district for a while.
... Well, I guess you could say that was the cute side of catgirls.
[Vanilla]: 「Hmm? Sniff sniff, sniff sniff...」
[Vanilla]: 「Something smells really nice over there.」
[Chocola]: 「You're right! Something smells really good, Master!」
[Kashou]: 「It definitely does. What is this smell...」
I turned towards the source of it.
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Welcome~!」
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Would you like to try some delicious, fresh takoyaki~?」
[Food Stand Cat]: 「Would you like to try some piping hot takoyaki with lots of bonito flakes on top~?」
[Chocola]: 「Wah, it's a takoyaki shop run by a catgirl! That's pretty rare, huh, Master?!」
ModelAnswer:
We need to output dialogues with speaker names. For narration, just text. Preserve honorifics. Onomatopoeia transliterate. Let's translate.

Narration: "あの後のスーパーでも同じやり取り。気まずくてしばらくあの商店街に行けないぞ。……まぁネコの可愛いところと言われればそうなんだけども。"

Translate: "The same exchange happened at the supermarket afterward. It's awkward, so I can't go to that shopping district for a while. ... Well, if you say it's because of the cat's cute side, then that's true."

But keep natural English. Use speaker names.

Now dialogues:

[バニラ]: 「ん？　くんくん、くんくん……」 -> Vanilla: "Hm? Kunkun, kunkun..."

[バニラ]: 「あっちからすごくいい匂いがする」 -> Vanilla: "There's a really good smell coming from over there."

[ショコラ]: 「ほんとだ、すごく香ばしくていい匂いがしますご主人さま！」 -> Chocola: "Yeah, it's so fragrant and smells great, Master!"

[嘉祥]: 「確かに。この匂いは……」 -> Minaduki Kashou: "Indeed. This smell is..."

Then narration: "匂いのする方角へと顔を向ける。" -> He turns his face toward the direction of the scent.

[屋台のネコ]: 「いらっしゃいませー！」 -> Cat at stall: "Welcome!"

[屋台のネコ]: 「おいしいできたてのたこやき、いかがですかー！」 -> Cat: "Freshly made takoyaki, would you like some?"

[屋台のネコ]: 「あっつあつで、かつおぶしたっぷりのたこやき、いかがですかー！」 -> Cat: "Hot and loaded with bonito flakes, how about that?"

[ショコラ]: 「わぁ、ネコのたこ焼き屋さんだ！　珍しいですね、ご主人さま！」 -> Chocola: "Wow, a cat's takoyaki shop! That's unusual, Master!"

Return.The same exchange happened at the supermarket afterward. It's awkward, so I can't go to that shopping district for a while. ... Well, if you say it's because of the cat's cute side, then that's true.

Vanilla: "Hm? Kunkun, kunkun..."

Vanilla: "There's a really good smell coming from over there."

Chocola: "Yeah, it's so fragrant and smells great, Master!"

Minaduki Kashou: "Indeed. This smell is…"

He turns his face toward the direction of the scent.

Cat at stall: "Welcome!"

Cat at stall: "Freshly made takoyaki, would you like some?"

Cat at stall: "Hot and loaded with bonito flakes, how about that?"

Chocola: "Wow, a cat's takoyaki shop! That's unusual, Master!"

[character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)

Question:
[ショコラ]: 「いい子になれるようにって！」
[バニラ]: 「時雨、厳しい。でもお陰様で色々と覚えた」
[店主]: 「そうなんだ？　良いご主人様なのね」
[ショコラ]: 「あ、でもご主人さまはご主人さまなんです！」
[ショコラ]: 「時雨ちゃんは時雨ちゃんですから！　ね、ご主人さま？」
[バニラ]: 「通訳すると、時雨は大事な友達」
[バニラ]: 「ご主人って呼ぶのはこっちのご主人だけってことで」
[店主]: 「あはは。愛されてるんだね、ご主人さまは？」
[嘉祥]: 「まぁ、ありがたいことに」
肘で軽く小突かれる。
照れくさいような苦笑いで返事を返す。
……外だと流石にちょっと照れくさい。
reference_answer:
[Chocola]: 「She said we'd grow up to be good catgirls if we listened to her!」
[Vanilla]: 「Shigure was tough on us. But thanks to her, we learned a lot.」
[Food Stand Owner]: 「Really? What a wonderful owner you have.」
[Chocola]: 「Ah, but Master is Master!」
[Chocola]: 「And Shigure-chan is Shigure-chan! Right, Master?」
[Vanilla]: 「In other words, Shigure is an important friend.」
[Vanilla]: 「And when we say 'Master,' we are referring to Master over here.」
[Food Stand Owner]: 「Ahaha! You're a very well-loved "master," aren't you?」
[Kashou]: 「Well, I am grateful.」
She lightly nudged me with her elbow.
I responded with an embarrassed, forced smile.
... Hearing this kind of stuff in public sure was embarrassing.
ModelAnswer:
We need to translate. Dialogue format: SPEAKER_NAME: "dialogue". For narration, just text. Preserve honorifics. Onomatopoeia transliterate. Let's produce.

Note: The last part includes actions and description. Should output as narration lines. Also the speaker names: Shocola (ショコラ) -> Chocola? Actually character name is Chocola. So use "Chocola". Vanilla, Minaduki Kashou (嘉祥). 店主 = shop owner. Use "Shop Owner" maybe but keep Japanese? Should be "店主". But rule says preserve honorifics; not about names. We'll use "店主".

Let's translate.

[ショコラ]: 「いい子になれるようにって！」 -> Chocola: "I want to become a good child!"

But maintain natural English. Use quotes.

[バニラ]: 「時雨、厳しい。でもお陰様で色々と覚えた」 -> Vanilla: "Shigure, you're strict. But thanks to you, I've learned a lot."

[店主]: 「そうなんだ？　良いご主人様なのね」 -> 店主: "Is that so? You're a good Master, aren't you?"

[ショコラ]: 「あ、でもご主人さまはご主人さまなんです！」 -> Chocola: "Ah, but the Master is the Master!"

[ショコラ]: 「時雨ちゃんは時雨ちゃんですから！　ね、ご主人さま？」 -> Chocola: "Shigure-chan is Shigure-chan! Right, Master?"

[バニラ]: 「通訳すると、時雨は大事な友達」 -> Vanilla: "In translation, Shigure is an important friend."

[バニラ]: 「ご主人って呼ぶのはこっちのご主人だけってことで」 -> Vanilla: "Calling someone 'Master' only applies to this Master."

[店主]: 「あはは。愛されてるんだね、ご主人さまは？」 -> 店主: "Ahaha. You're being loved, aren't you, Master?"

[嘉祥]: 「まぁ、ありがたいことに」肘で軽く小突かれる。照れくさいような苦笑いで返事を返す。……外だと流石にちょっと照れくさい。 -> Minaduki Kashou: "Well, I'm grateful." (Then action: He is lightly poked with his elbow. He returns a shy smile.) ... It's a bit embarrassing outside.

We need to output narration lines without speaker tags. So after the last dialogue, we have narration: "He is lightly poked with his elbow..." etc.

Let's produce final.Chocola: "I want to become a good child!"

Vanilla: "Shigure, you're strict. But thanks to you, I've learned a lot."

店主: "Is that so? You're a good Master, aren't you?"

Chocola: "Ah, but the Master is the Master!"

Chocola: "Shigure-chan is Shigure-chan! Right, Master?"

Vanilla: "In translation, Shigure is an important friend."

Vanilla: "Calling someone 'Master' only applies to this Master."

店主: "Ahaha. You're being loved, aren't you, Master?"

Minaduki Kashou: "Well, I'm grateful."
He is lightly poked with his elbow.
He returns a shy smile that feels a little embarrassed...
Outside, it's indeed a bit embarrassing.

Question:
無慈悲な電子音が響く携帯電話を見つめる。
……時雨と連絡さえ付けば、すぐに解決すると思ってたのに。
[ショコラ]: 「はむ、んぐんぐんぐ、朝ごはんおいしーですね！」
[ショコラ]: 「ご主人さまのごはんはいつでもおいしーですにゃー♪」
[バニラ]: 「ショコラ、ほっぺにケチャップ付いてる」
[バニラ]: 「芸術的にかわいい。舐めてあげちゃう。ぺろぺろ」
当の本人たちはサンドウィッチを満足そうに頬張っている。
ちなみに中身はトマトとチーズとレタス。
それに半熟の目玉焼きを挟み込んだシンプルなもの。
朝食だったらまぁこんなもんだろ。
[嘉祥]: 「お前ら、今日こそは家に帰るんだからな？」
reference_answer:
As the ruthless electronic buzz of the dropped call echoed, I stared at my cell phone.
... And here I thought that I could sort all this out if I could just talk to Shigure.
[Chocola]: 「Munch munch munch, breakfast tastes good!」
[Chocola]: 「Master's breakfast always tastes good, meow~ ♪」
[Vanilla]: 「Chocola, there's some ketchup on your cheek.」
[Vanilla]: 「It's cutely artistic. I'll lick it off. Shlurp slurp~」
The catgirls in question were happily stuffing themselves with sandwiches.
These sandwiches incidentally contained tomato, cheese, and lettuce.
With an over-easy fried egg tucked inside all of that, it was a simple meal.
Breakfast was pretty much like this.
[Kashou]: 「You two are definitely going home today, okay?」

Then dialogues.

[ショコラ]: 「はむ、んぐんぐんぐ、朝ごはんおいしーですね！」 => "Ha mu, mungun gungu, breakfast is so tasty!"

But keep onomatopoeia: "ha mu" maybe. We'll transliterate as "hamu". So: "hamu, mungungungu, breakfast is delicious!" Keep honorifics? none.

Kashou: "You guys, today I'm finally going home, you know?"

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
ハキハキとした笑顔で伝票とペンを差し出される。
[嘉祥]: 「そうですね、えっと……」
受け取った伝票を改めて確認する。
[嘉祥]: 「……どうも、自分が頼んだものと違うみたいなんですけども」
[食器業者]: 「……え、本当ですか？」
[食器業者]: 「それは、品物が違う……ということでしょうか？」
[嘉祥]: 「いえ、頼んだものも確かに入ってるみたいなのですが……」
店内に積まれたダンボールへと視線を向ける。
小さな店内に積まれたダンボールの山、山、山。
むしろ店内がほぼダンボールになっていた。
[嘉祥]: 「見ての通り、ウチではこんなにたくさんの食器は必要ないので……」
[食器業者]: 「す、すみません！　すぐに本社に確認しますので！」
[食器業者]: 「少々お待ち頂いてもよろしいでしょうか！？」
reference_answer:
She smiled brightly and brought out the invoice along with a pen.
[Kashou]: 「Okay, let's see...」
I looked over the sales invoice I received once more.
[Kashou]: 「... Somehow, this doesn't look like what I ordered.」
[Tableware Seller]: 「... Huh, is that so?」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Are you saying that these... aren't the correct items?」
[Kashou]: 「No, the stuff I ordered is in here too, but...」
I looked over at the pile of boxes inside the bakery.
Inside of my tiny bakery was a mountain of boxes. A MOUNTAIN.
It was as if the inside of the bakery had become completely made of boxes.
[Kashou]: 「As you can see, we don't need this much tableware inside the bakery...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「I-I'm sorry! I'll check with the main office right away!」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Could you give me a few moments?」

Dialogue lines:

[嘉祥] is Minaduki Kashou. Use "Minaduki Kashou:".

[食器業者] maybe "Dishware Vendor:" or "Vendor:". Keep honorific? Not needed.

Translate sentences.

First line narration: "ハキハキとした笑顔で伝票とペンを差し出される。" -> "A bright smile is offered along with the invoice and a pen." But format: no speaker, just text. Use natural English.

Then [嘉祥]: 「そうですね、えっと……」 -> "Minaduki Kashou: 'Well, um...'"

Narration: "店内に積まれたダンボールへと視線を向ける。小さな店内に積まれたダンボールの山、山、山。むしろ店内がほぼダンボールになっていた。" -> "He turns his gaze to the stack of cardboard boxes in the shop. A pile, a pile, a pile of them—almost the entire interior was covered in cardboard."

metadata: [character] Name: Minaduki Kashou (水無月 嘉祥) | Gender: Male | Aliases: Master (ご主人さま)
Question:
[食器業者]: 「こちらのミスで、別の注文書と混じってしまっていたようでして……」
[食器業者]: 「水無月様の方もすぐにご入用と思いますので……」
[食器業者]: 「もしよろしければ、ご注文分の食器を受け取って頂ければと思うのですが……」
[嘉祥]: 「注文分を受け取れって……」
[嘉祥]: 「……え？　この中からですか？」
そびえ立つダンボールの山。
思わず言葉に詰まる。
どれも一様に同じ箱なわけで。
中身を開けてみるまで何が入っているのか分からない。
しかも伝票を見ればどれも最高級のティーセットや食器。
なので、扱いにも細心の注意を払わないととんでもないことになる。
[嘉祥]: 「あの、確かに開店準備もあるので今日もらえたら嬉しいですけども……」
[嘉祥]: 「……今からこれを全部って、相当時間かかりますよね？」
reference_answer:
[Tableware Seller]: 「Because of an error on our part, it appears that another order got mixed in with yours...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「I imagine that you may be in need of these items right away, Mr. Minaduki...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「So if at all possible, if you would be able to accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「Accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「... Huh? From all this?」
The mountain of cardboard boxes towered over everything.
I was at a loss for words.
Every box was of equal size.
I wouldn't know what was inside each of them without opening them up.
On top of that, looking at the sales invoice, I could see that they all contained expensive tea sets and tableware.
And if I accepted it all, it would be a lot of work to deal with all the new items.
[Kashou]: 「Uhm, there's still things that need doing in advance of my bakery's opening, so I don't mind accepting these...」
[Kashou]: 「... but it's going to take a while to deal with all of this.」
ModelAnswer:
We need to translate. Provide speaker tags. No commentary. Use honorifics. Let's produce.食器業者: "It seems this was a mistake on our part, and it got mixed up with another order..."
食器業者: "I think you, Minaduki-sama, will need it soon as well..."
食器業者: "If it's alright, I'd like you to accept the dishes that were ordered for you..."
嘉祥: "You want me to take the order?"
嘉祥: "...Huh? From this pile?"
A towering stack of cardboard boxes.
I find myself at a loss for words.
They all look identical.
Until I open them, I don't know what's inside.
And when I look at the invoices, they are all top‑grade tea sets and dishes.
So if I'm not careful with handling them, it could become a disaster.
嘉祥: "Um, sure. Since there's also opening preparations, I'd be happy to get them today..."
嘉祥: "...If I take all of these now, it'll take quite some time, won't it?"

[character] Name: Chocola (ショコラ) | Gender: Female
Question:
[嘉祥]: 「えーと、ショート、チーズ、フルーツが２個ずつに……」
[ショコラ]: 「そわそわそわそわ」
[嘉祥]: 「ガトー、ミルフィーユ、モンブラン……」
[ショコラ]: 「うずうずうずうず」
[嘉祥]: 「うん、伝票通り間違いないな」
[ショコラ]: 「うわーい！　じゃあ褒めてください！　ナデナデ！！」
[嘉祥]: 「はいはい（なでなで）」
[嘉祥]: 「それじゃ、車とか人に気を付けて行って来いよ」
[ショコラ]: 「はーい、行ってきまーす！」
[ショコラ]: 「でも、あともうひとつ忘れ物ですよ？」
[嘉祥]: 「ん？　忘れたって、後は何も――」
[ショコラ]: 「行ってきますの、ちゅ♪」
[嘉祥]: 「ちょ、ショコラっ……！？」
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Let's see, two shortcakes, two cheesecakes, two fruit tarts...」
[Chocola]: 「Fidget fidget fidget~」
[Kashou]: 「... one gateau, one millie-feuille, one montblanc...」
[Chocola]: 「Twitch twitch twitch~」
[Kashou]: 「Yep, it's the same as the sales invoice.」
[Chocola]: 「Yay~! Chocola wants a reward, then! Pet her, pet her!!」
[Kashou]: 「Okay, okay. Pat pat...」
[Kashou]: 「Okay then, be careful of cars and people and come back safe and sound!」
[Chocola]: 「Okay~ I'm off~!」
[Chocola]: 「Ah, you're forgetting something though, Master!」
[Kashou]: 「Hm? Forgot what? There's nothing els--」
[Chocola]: 「I'll be off, mwah! ♪」
[Kashou]: 「Ch-Chocola...?!」
ModelAnswer:
We need to output dialogues with speaker names. Use given names: Minaduki Kashou is 嘉祥, alias Master (ご主人さま). Chocola is ショコラ. So output lines like "嘉祥: \"...\"" but we should use the name? The rule says SPEAKER_NAME: "DIALOGUE". Should we use Japanese names or English? Probably keep as given names: Minaduki Kashou and Chocola. Use honorifics preserved. Let's translate.

Line1: 「えーと、ショート、チーズ、フルーツが２個ずつに……」 => "Um, short, cheese, fruit two each..." maybe "Hmm, shortcake, cheese, fruits two each..."

But keep natural English. I'll do: "Um, shortcakes, cheese, and fruits—two of each..."

Line2: ショコラ: 「そわそわそわそわ」 => "Sowa sowa sowa sowa" (onomatopoeia). Keep as is.

Line3: 嘉祥: 「ガトー、ミルフィーユ、モンブラン……」 => "Gateau, mille-feuille, Montblanc..."

Line4: ショコラ: 「うずうずうずうず」 => "Uzu uzu uzu uzu" (maybe "Uzuzuzu").

Line5: 嘉祥: 「うん、伝票通り間違いないな」 => "Yeah, the receipt says it's correct."

Line6: ショコラ: 「うわーい！　じゃあ褒めてください！　ナデナデ！！」 => "Yay! Then please praise me! Pat pat!!"

Line7: 嘉祥: 「はいはい（なでなで）」 => "Alright, alright (patting)"

Line8: 嘉祥: 「それじゃ、車とか人に気を付けて行って来いよ」 => "Well then, be careful of cars and people. Go!"

Line9: ショコラ: 「はーい、行ってきまーす！」 => "Okay, I'm off!"

Line10: ショコラ: 「でも、あともうひとつ忘れ物ですよ？」 => "But there's one more thing I forgot, you know?"

Line11: 嘉祥: 「ん？　忘れたって、後は何も――」 => "Huh? You say you forgot—what else is there?"

Line12: ショコラ: 「行ってきますの、ちゅ♪」 => "I'm off, chu~" (cute)

Line13: 嘉祥: 「ちょ、ショコラっ……！？」 => "Wait, Chocola...!?" 

Now output.Minaduki Kashou: "Um, shortcakes, cheese, and fruits—two of each…"
Chocola: "Sowa sowa sowa sowa"
Minaduki Kashou: "Gateau, mille-feuille, Montblanc…"
Chocola: "Uzu uzu uzu uzu"
Minaduki Kashou: "Yeah, the receipt says it's correct."
Chocola: "Yay! Then please praise me! Pat pat!!"
Minaduki Kashou: "Alright, alright (patting)"
Minaduki Kashou: "Well then, be careful of cars and people. Go!"
Chocola: "Okay, I'm off!"
Chocola: "But there's one more thing I forgot, you know?"
Minaduki Kashou: "Huh? You say you forgot—what else is there?"
Chocola: "I'm off, chu~"
Minaduki Kashou: "Wait, Chocola…!?"

Question:
目の前の二匹に目を奪われてしまう。
[ショコラ]: 「んふふ♪　いつからこんなにしてたの？」
[ショコラ]: 「こんなにしたままで、澄まし顔でお店に立ってたのかにゃ？」
[バニラ]: 「そ、そんなことにゃ……！　あ、んあぁっ……！　は、にゃぁぁ……！！」
[バニラ]: 「はぁ、はぁぁ……！　ほんとに、もうやめ……！　んんぅっ……！」
[ショコラ]: 「バニラが嘘つくからでしょ？」
[ショコラ]: 「ホントのこと言わないと止めてあげないんだから……♪」
[バニラ]: 「ほ、ほんとのことって……」
[バニラ]: 「……ご主人」
助けを求めるように視線を向けて来る。
[ショコラ]: 「ご主人さまに助けを求めちゃだーめ」
[ショコラ]: 「ほら。素直に言わないと、バニラもつらいでしょ？」
reference_answer:
... as I was entranced by the two catgirls in front of my eyes.
[Chocola]: 「Mufufu~ ♪ How long have you been holding out for?」
[Chocola]: 「You were working in the store with such a demure face while you were like this the whole time, meow?」
[Vanilla]: 「Th-That's not true...! Ah, muah...! Hah, meow...!」
[Vanilla]: 「Hah, haah...! I really can't... take it anymore...! Mmhh...!」
[Chocola]: 「That's because you're lying, isn't it, Vanilla?」
[Chocola]: 「Unless you tell the truth, Chocola isn't going to stop~ ♪」
[Vanilla]: 「I-I'm telling you, it's true...」
[Vanilla]: 「... Master.」
She looked over at me, hoping I'd cut in and rescue her.
[Chocola]: 「You can't ask Master to save youuu~」
[Chocola]: 「Come on~ Lying will just make it worse for you, right?」
ModelAnswer:

First line: "目の前の二匹に目を奪われてしまう。" -> "I can't help but be captivated by the two in front of me." or "I'm mesmerized by the two before me."

Then dialogues:

バニラ: 「はぁ、はぁぁ……！　ほんとに、もうやめ……！　んんぅっ……！」 -> "Haa, haa...! Really, stop already...! Nnnuh..."

ショコラ: 「バニラが嘘つくからでしょ？」 -> "Because Vanilla is lying, right?"

ショコラ: 「ホントのこと言わないと止めてあげないんだから……♪」 -> "If you don't tell the truth, I won't stop you... ♪"

Now output.I can't help but be captivated by the two in front of me.

バニラ: "Haa, haa...! Really, stop already...! Nnnuh..."
ショコラ: "Because Vanilla is lying, right?"
ショコラ: "If you don't tell the truth, I won't stop you... ♪"

She looks toward me as if asking for help.

Question:
仕入れ先に頼みたいことがあった。急ぎではないが、早いうちに電話しておいたほうがいい。
個人経営のパティスリーなら普通のことだと思うが、俺は仕入れ先の一つ一つと自分で交渉をしている。
一般流通されていないような食材も、まとまった量を仕入れるなら、売ってくれる農家もある。
味の探究は、食材を探す旅でもあった。
皆が観光で盛り上がっているときに、仕事の話をするのも野暮なので、俺は私用があると言って、部屋を離れる。
念のために旅館からも出て、静かな場所で話すことにした。
電話をかける。
[嘉祥]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[嘉祥]: 「ふぅ……」
国外からの注文ということで先方に驚かれたが、どうにか発送してくれそうだ。
俺は旅館の中へと戻る。
reference_answer:
There's something I wanna request from a supplier. It's no rush, but it's a good idea to give him a phone call as soon as possible.
I think it's pretty common for an independently-owned patisserie, but I negotiate with every single supplier on my own.
Even for ingredients not in circulation for the general public, if I need to replenish my supply of them in bulk, there are farmers who will buy it for me.
Researching flavors is also a journey to search for ingredients.
Since it'd be uncouth of me to talk about work when everyone is excited about sightseeing, I tell them that I have personal business to take care of and leave the room.
Just to be sure, I leave the inn and decide to talk someplace quieter.
I make my phone call.
[Kashou]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[Kashou]: 「Phew...」
I was met with surprise from the other person on the line since it was an order from overseas, but it seems they'll be putting in my order.
I return to the inn.

[Kashou]: 「Well then, maybe I should have one.」
I buy a hot-spring manju bun from the stand.
It's freshly made and piping hot.
I take a bite into it, and my mouth is greeted by a fluffy and moist sensation.
Atop my tongue, the red bean paste starts to break down, and the sweetness starts to spread.
[Kashou]: 「Now I see... Fff, Fff... This is pretty good.」
Neither the Western sweets I make nor the Japanese sweets my family makes are ever served warm.
Eating a piping-hot manju bun while huffing to cool it down in my mouth is a pretty interesting experience in its own right.
[Kashou]: 「You know, I've been to the hot spring district plenty of times in the past, but... I never ate one of these before.」
Mostly because the catgirls weren't around back then.
Even when the four of us—my parents, Shigure, and I—traveled, buying local snacks and eating never came into the equation.

Even the hot‑spring town that is bustling with tourists during the day turns into an entirely different atmosphere by midnight.  

I looked down from the bridge.  
It was dark.  
Only the sound of water flowing in the river could be heard.  

The moon reflected on the surface of the river seemed visible… no, was that the light from a streetlamp?  
To check, I peered under the bridge.
